skillTree.localised_description: Making no sound and leaving no trace, Shadwen rides as if someones shadow - silent and steadfast.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Ulgu, the Lore of Shadow, also called the Fifth Lore, is the Grey Wind of Magic, and one which is the Aethyr's embodiment of and reaction to the emotional experience among mortals of being lost or confused.
Looking at the dilapidated property the Order calls its College, few would realise its owners are one of the most far-reaching (and in some ways among the most powerful) organisations in the Empire.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Sword of Judgement is the primary symbol of the Grey College, and the wielders of the Wind of Ulgu for the Empire. It is equal parts promise and threat, for a sword can be wielded in defence or in judgement, and the Grey Wizards are deep in the prosecution of both.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +8 for Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those with witchsight see a thick, impenetrable fog rolling across the earth, invoking a sense of mistrust and confusion in ordinary people who pass through it.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

skillTree.localised_description: The Wizard produces a stringless fiddle and plays a haunting dirge that drives all sense of hope and urgency away, rendering the foe passive and prone.

attributes.bullet_text:
Bound Fire Daemons cannot be routed, but they take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Bound Fire Daemons also have:
	Physical Resistance
	Fire Resistance
	Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Bound Fire Daemons are also Unbreakable whilst most of their hit points are remaining.

Constructs cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Constructs also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Constructs may also have their hit points restored and stats boosted by special characters such as the Tomb Kings Necrotect.

Daemonic units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is low.
	
	Daemonic units also have:
	Physical Resistance
	 Fear and Terror Immunity

Elementals cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Elementals also have:
	Physical Resistance
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Penumbral Pendulum"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.
When cast this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Enfeebling Foe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The Wizard destroys their enemies from within, corroding foes' minds with doubt and crisis.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Withering"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Withering Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Withering Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The supernatural solution is often the best; weapons materialise before the caster's allies, allowing them to slice through flesh, soul, and consciousness.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Okkam's Mindrazor"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord expects his men to practice the disciplines of the Pistolkorps, and all be expert marksmen.

skillTree.localised_description: Honest Empire-forged steel is all a state trooper could ask when confronting the myriad foes in battle.

skillTree.localised_description: Despite what the Dwarfs think, no other race can bring to bear such devastating artillery volleys.

skillTree.localised_description: The frontline will either make or break you. Those who survive become the backbone of any army.

skillTree.localised_description: Some men grow to relish war, dulled to the pain and living solely for the thrill of the kill.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

items.colour_text: None of the other orders are more adept at wielding the blade as the grey wizards. Reiner Starke carries his family sigil hidden deep within his cloak, yet it only takes a blink for him to present it. True to their order's symbol, the shadowmancers usually carry swords, often concealed beneath their cloaks. They are competent fighters.

item_set.name: The Trickster Wizards
item_set.description: Shadowmancers, like the hierophants of the Light Order, are tasked primarily with the persecution of the enemies within Imperial society and the protection of the ideals of the Empire. But where the Hierophants are predominantly exorcists, seeking out and aiding only those who are possessed by Daemons or the very darkest magic, the shadowmancers serve as diplomats, spies, and even assassins.

items.colour_text: The wand was originally won by the Archmage Ptolos of the Grey College at the Battle of Blood Keep and has been in the possession of the shadowmancers ever since. Starke is ruthless in his dealings with those he sees as the enemies of the Empire and is prepared to sanction almost any means to ensure what he sees as the protection of the Empire, making him the perfect wielder of the Grey Wand.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

item_set.name: The Trickster Wizards
item_set.description: Shadowmancers, like the hierophants of the Light Order, are tasked primarily with the persecution of the enemies within Imperial society and the protection of the ideals of the Empire. But where the Hierophants are predominantly exorcists, seeking out and aiding only those who are possessed by Daemons or the very darkest magic, the shadowmancers serve as diplomats, spies, and even assassins.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: He is the shadow of Ulgu, guardian of judgement and coil of mists. He is the Magister Patriach of the Grey Order.
